title: Bi-Weekly Music Discussion Thread
selftext:
What is r/India listening to? Share and discuss songs, playlists, artists, or anything music-related here!

If you're a musician yourself, please share your work so we can all hear what up-and-coming musicians are doing these days.

Don't just mention stuff, link it! Links that are official and provided by the artists themselves are preferred.

**Music Thread is posted every two weeks on Tuesday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Music+Discussion+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/06d0xwq1x8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=4195dbb767ebd70a3209ea46a4497062e788c176
comments:
Song Name - Love Hime ( Yowamushi Pedal )

https://youtu.be/dv13gl0a-FA

KIDS SEE GHOSTS - Reborn
https://youtu.be/hQC8COGQ4BM

Bloodywood- Gadar

https://music.youtube.com/watch?v=6YkMUOJx_B4&feature=share

Also recommend their other songs

My two recos for the thread:

* [Still I Wait](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t51_2ZEyuj4) by Swedish singer-songwriter Anna Leone. Beautiful acoustic music.
* [Forever](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LbDprMno3bo) by Australian EDM act Flight Facilities. Chill vibe to this track.

This cover of Mathura Nagarpati -- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E7l-ouhp33M

Original by Shubha Mudgal -- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5DzHA87W3Z0
This cover of Lambi Judaai by Komal Rizvi -- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1mraYxZa6xE

This song by Dengue fever [this song ](https://open.spotify.com/track/3Rhk6AVtrrUbAJuQnuCBvV?si=mE5XnVTgTvqsx-KQ_QdLig&utm_source=copy-link)

Saharwi music from North Africa. 
Tinarwen, Mariam Hasen and Ali Farkha Toure. [playlist ](https://open.spotify.com/playlist/37i9dQZF1DWWuJFsTMqHYX?si=RyDWEQJBRZq95xZBdmgOOg&utm_source=copy-link)

I cant go that far west and not come back east a little bit. 

Tun Milen by Rabbi Shergill -- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VDtlJK_e4kI
That was an amazing cover.

[Clair de Lune by  Flight Facilities ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jcu1AHaTchM)
will forever remain my favorite late night drive song.
Was one of my favourite songs to get high to ;)
What's the present choice,  theoretically of course
Ha ha, of course ;) I guess apricots by bicep? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Govg_XmORLE

Are you me, lmao

[Meli](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EKqelaVoenI) by them is my current favorite. The second half of the song is pure bliss.
Sahi yaar! Had only heard apricots, atlas and sundial off their last album, will need to hear the rest of it now, pretty sure there'll be more gems like this! :)

[Bombay Bandook - Tilak](https://youtu.be/AaFRfcLssok)

Underrated indie rock

If anybody of y'all is into metal music, check out this insane vocal demonstration of my favorite Deathcore song of 2021, **To the Hellfire** by *Lorna Shore*. This song has blown my mind every time I listen to it. [Lorna Shore - To the Hellfire - Vocal Playthrough](https://youtu.be/VO3NSHk3wl0)

Will Ramos is a menace.
This was released later as part of the deluxe version, [Light](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j-vw68nduWc) is also another delight
These guys are going places and I am happy for them!! This song is very Limp Bizkit ish.

Been listening to the Parcels [self titled debut album](https://youtube.com/playlist?list=OLAK5uy_nkbeXTmdInAD2lmdRXwe75PSb-6XF3Hf8) again. I missed it so much, it's so good. 

It's electronica funk with rock and pop elements
